author: BrucePay
body:
AWS PowerShell Lambda uses the `ResetRunspaceState()` API as part of a performance optimization  when running PowerShell scripts on Lambda. The use of this API causes `$?` to become useless in a runspace after `ResetRunspaceState()` is called. 

# Steps to reproduce

```powershell

$iss = [System.Management.Automation.Runspaces.InitialSessionState]::CreateDefault()
$rs = [RunspaceFactory]::CreateRunspace($iss);
$rs.Open();

# Now reset the runspace state
#$rs.ResetRunspaceState();

$ps = [powershell]::Create($rs).AddScript(@'
        Get-Date
        [console]::WriteLine("After Get-Date; hook is $?")

        Get-Content NoSuchFile
        [console]::WriteLine("After Get-Content; hook is $?")

        # Customer's xample
        try { NoSuchCommand } catch {}
        [console]::WriteLine("After try/catch; hook is $?")
'@)

$ps.Invoke()

```

# Expected behavior

The `$?` variable should accurately reflect that execution status of the last command like this:

```none
After Get-Date; hook is True
After Get-Content; hook is False
After try/catch; hook is False
```

# Actual behavior

What actually happens is that, regardless of the execution status of the last command, `$?` is always true.

```none
After Get-Date; hook is True
After Get-Content; hook is True
After try/catch; hook is True
```

It looks like all that's required to fix this is to remove the line of code in `ResetRunspaceState()` that's overwriting the `$?` variable, especially given that there's no real reason to be doing this in the first place. Note: this issue doesn't affect the chaining operators that @rjmholt added so that code must be using the underlying data element. 

# Environment data
Note: This bug appears to repro on all versions of PowerShell.

```none
Name                           Value
----                           -----
PSVersion                      7.0.0-preview.6
PSEdition                      Core
GitCommitId                    7.0.0-preview.6-18-g2a76aa10ee804f47ad2499915d206e1dd470898d
OS                             Microsoft Windows 10.0.18363
Platform                       Win32NT
PSCompatibleVersions           {1.0, 2.0, 3.0, 4.0…}
PSRemotingProtocolVersion      2.3
SerializationVersion           1.1.0.1
WSManStackVersion              3.0
```
title: Using the ResetRunspaceState() API breaks $? which affects AWS Lambda PowerShell users.
